multiple_choice_question.text: What do the red lines in Figure 1(c) represent?
What does the symbol "NI" stand for in the phase diagram (Figure 2(a))?
What does Figure 3(a) illustrate regarding the addition of 2D time-reversal symmetric TIs to the surfaces bordering the hinge?
choices: It breaks the mirror symmetry and gaps the hinge states.
It changes the net mirror chirality of the hinge.
It adds an even number of hinge modes without changing the net mirror chirality.
It transforms helical hinge modes into chiral hinge modes.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 4(b), which Dirac cones are gapped in SnTe with uniaxial strain along the (110) direction?
choices: The ones enforced by a mirror Chern number.
The ones represented by dashed lines.
The ones crossed by dotted mirror symmetries.
